data.title: Use File Icon for TS Path Completions
data.body:
Part of #17331

Updates path completions for directories and files to use a file icon instead of the generic icon they currently use.

data.title: Disable the new javascript IntelliSense in html...
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04/Windows-10
I know lots of users were waiting for it but in my case it breaks because I tend to fill some JS Global vars (mostly for i18n use) with server side code templating system for html (with Golang and personalized delimiters).
```
(*.html file)
<script>
var Globals = {
    someVar: [[T "translated"]]
}
</script>
```
... breaks awfully.
I've tried settings.json:
```
    "html.format.unformatted": "script",
    "javascript.format.enable": false,
    "html.format.enable": false,
    "typescript.validate.enable": false,
    "javascript.validate.enable": false,
    "files.associations": {
         "*.html": "html"
    }
```
without success..
Is there any way?
Thanks and sorry if it's the wrong place to ask but if not possible then tag it with "feature-request" please!

data.title: "Reload this window to activate the extension X" - wording

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d, 2016-12-13T17:45:32.595Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Theme-Flat|gerane|0.0.2|
|intellij-idea-keybindings|k--kato|0.2.7|
|easy-less|mrcrowl|1.2.5|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|
|vs-keybindings|ms-vscode|0.1.2|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.2.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Install more than one extension and/or uninstall one or more extensions.
2. Click the "reload" button
3. The popup confirmation asks to reload the window to activate/deactivate the extension that was just clicked. However, all other pending activations will also be done.

Should change the wording to indicate that all pending changes will be done.

data.title: Editors opened from the menu bar should not open in preview mode
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. From menu... File / Preferences / Workplace Settings
2. From menu... Help / Release Notes
-> Settings are closed

Editors opened from the menu bar should not open in preview mode so that they stay open.

See also #17428.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (c5df118575aebc2e28a4addd4d4a29b899a514c5, 2016-12-16T11:29:57.289Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|vscode-jasmine-es5|deerawan|1.0.1|
|python|donjayamanne|0.3.18|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.3.5|
|vscode-auto-open-markdown-preview|hnw|0.0.3|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.4.0|
|docthis|joelday|0.3.4|
|markdown-shortcuts|mdickin|0.4.1|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.2.1|
|guides|spywhere|0.5.1|
|gitblame|waderyan|1.3.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

I don't have any specific steps to reproduce, as I can't find any pattern as to when auto-save will/won't work. I have "files.autoSave": "onFocusChange" set in my config, as it has been for several months. Yesterday is the first time I ever noticed this not working. If I restart my editor, it seems to start working again, but eventually it breaks again several minutes later.

data.title: editor.action.insertLineBefore does not fire onDidChangeTextEditorSelection
data.body:
The VsCodeVim plugin uses insert line before and insert line after commands.

`editor.action.insertLineBefore` 
`editor.action.insertLineAfter`

We then wait for the onDidChangeTextEditorSelection to fire to know that the operation was completed.

Now after running insertLineBefore, the event is NOT fired. As soon as you move the cursor from here it is, but not just when running the action, even though the cursor position changed

1. Is there a reason why this event stopped firing for these commands?
2. Is there a better way for us to know a command completed, we await and then how do we know the actual change occurred.

data.title: Release notes display
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d, 2016-12-13T17:45:32.595Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Theme-Flat|gerane|0.0.2|
|easy-less|mrcrowl|1.2.5|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|
|vs-keybindings|ms-vscode|0.1.1|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.2.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  View the release notes (November 2016)
2.  Scroll down as you read them
3.  Switch to another tab to view some code
4.  Switch back to the release notes
5.  The release notes reload and are at the top of the display.

This makes it very hard to read, as it continually reverts to the top of the long document and reloads every time the tab is switched.

data.title: "Cannot read property 'substring' of undefined" when formatting adding newline at end of file
data.body:
From https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-go/issues/690

- On Linux or Windows, Install Go extension
- Set `"go.formatOnSave": false`
- Open any go file with no newline at the end of the file like
```go
package main

func foo() {
}
```
- "Format document"

The Go extension returns one edit which inserts a newline at the end of the document. This looks correct to me. At some point, a calculation in vscode fails because the end of the edit is off the end of an array of lines.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/21279628/ff8a5430-c395-11e6-801a-a01950673c07.png)

Doesn't repro on MacOS because the formatter there apparently doesn't return a trailing newline.

Doesn't repro with the Go extension's 'format on save' because it works through extension APIs. Also reported for python files.

data.title: Fix package.json Auto complete
data.body:
Fixes #17342

**Bug**
I believe that 739d8ca77f6215a5a385587e6e6c7d66fdbe15c6 introduced a regression for package.json auto complete where we end up inserting the text `*` when completing dependency versions

**Fix**
Insert `""` instead of star to match previous behavior better

data.title: Explorer File/Folder Filter
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16

With npm 3, the `node_modules` folder gets fairly large, so it would be nice if there was an input box in the `explorer` menu that I could type into and it would hide items that don't match the search.

For example when I am looking for a particular folder such as `materialize-css` I could just type `material` into the search box and all matching files/folders would be left in the view and everything would get hidden.

data.title: editor.renderWhitespace: "boundary" toggles back to "all"

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: win 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  add "editor.renderWhitespace": "boundary" to settings.json
2.  close and reopen vscode
3. open existing document (doc whitespace shown: boundary)
4. Toggle Render Whitespace (doc whitespace shown: none)
5. Toggle Render Whitespace (doc whitespace shown: all) <--- should toggle back to boundary

- Simply closing and reopening the file keeps the whitespace the same as before closing (either none or all)
- closing then reopening vscode resets whitespace shown to boundary
- I would like either a 3-way whitespace toggle (none, boundary, or all) or make the toggle work between render none and render user-specified

data.title: Cannot unbind wordWrap
data.body:
Extracted from #17406

VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (3874693, 2016-12-13T17:38:28.425Z)
OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. On macOS choose Polish programmer keyboard layout in System Preferences
2. Go to **Preferences > Keyboard Shortcuts** and unbind wordWrap:

```json
{ "key": "alt+z",                 "command": "-editor.action.toggleWordWrap" }
```
3. Type `alt+z`
-> `` is inserted and word-warp is toggled

//cc @mikchmie @coreh

data.title: Render Markdown of JSDoc
data.body:
_From @waderyan on November 11, 2016 22:34_

_From @mohsen1 on November 7, 2016 18:37_

- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: macOS

I'm expecting 

```ts
/**
 * This is foo
 * Foo is great! Use it like this:
 * 
 * ```ts
 * const foo = new Foo(); 
 * ```
 */
function Foo() {

}


var f = new Fo
```

I was expecting my Markdown to be rendered here:

data.title: Go to definition is broken on recusive function references
data.body:
_From @zhengbli on October 15, 2016 8:8_

<!-- BUGS: Please use this template. -->

<!-- QUESTIONS: This is not a general support forum! Ask Qs at http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/typescript -->

<!-- SUGGESTIONS: See https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript-wiki/blob/master/Writing-Good-Design-Proposals.md -->

**TypeScript Version:** nightly (2.1.0-dev.20161014)

**Code**

``` ts
function tttt() {
    /*cursor position*/tttt(); // <- "go to definition" doesn't go to the function declaration
}
```


_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/TypeScript#11657_

data.title: Search does not work in UTF-16 LE encoded files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create and open a test_folder in VSCode.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12904270/21273630/b495707c-c381-11e6-8465-4e191be8b989.png)

2. Add an XML file encoded in UTF-16 LE.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12904270/21273728/1f9af342-c382-11e6-8cdf-76a55ecc9c5e.png)

3. Add a javascript file encoded in UTF-8.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12904270/21273749/399b4134-c382-11e6-9471-a2bc6fcf2543.png)

4. Make sure both files are closed. Then search for text that can be found in both files. Note that only the javascript file is actually listed in the results.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12904270/21273826/9dc13592-c382-11e6-8fb7-cb1e58169400.png)

Note: The XML file encoded in UTF-16 LE _is_ found only if it is currently open in VSCode.

data.title: Jumping to variable in snippet does not scroll
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (c5df118575aebc2e28a4addd4d4a29b899a514c5, 2016-12-16T11:23:02.577Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0

1. Create snippet like this:

```ts
"test": {
		"prefix": "test",
		"body": ["Very very very very very very very very very very very very very long text ${var} "]
	}
```

2. Have small VSCode window

3. Use snippet

4. Cursor is at `${var}` but you cannot see it because it did not scroll

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/21273753/fff75b6e-c392-11e6-9ba1-69d960b99f81.png)

data.title: Esc twice to enter zen mode?
data.body:
I really like pressing Esc twice to leave Zen mode. But the shortcut to enter, K, Z, is kinda cumbersome.

I'd like to suggest that maybe we could make esc twice a default to _enter_ Zen mode as well? (Not sure if it would interfere with VIM emulation plugins or not.)
